resources.string: Engage in regular physical activity to reduce stress and avoid unhealthy coping mechanisms.
Build a strong support network and communicate openly with friends and family.
Avoid environments where addictive substances are easily accessible.
Educate yourself about the risks and consequences of addiction.
Practice mindfulness and find healthy hobbies to stay balanced and focused.
Listen without judgment and offer a supportive environment for your friend to speak openly.
Encourage your friend to seek professional help and offer to accompany them if needed.
Avoid enabling the behavior and set healthy boundaries to protect both yourself and your friend.
Be patient, as recovery is a process, and show consistent support over time.
Provide information about local support groups or resources that can assist in recovery.
